latest.title: Strategic Entry into Saudi Arabia via MISA
latest.content:
20 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 5090P
Active Energy Group PLC
20 January 2026
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Article 7 of the UK version of Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 which is part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended ("MAR"). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
20 January 2026
Active Energy Group plc
("Active Energy", the "Company" or the "Group")
Strategic Entry into Saudi Arabia via MISA Entrepreneur Licence
Active Energy Group plc
(AIM: AEG | OTC: AEUSF)
, the renewable energy and digital infrastructure company, announces that it has been successfully granted an Entrepreneur Licence by the Ministry of Investment of Saudi Arabia ("
MISA
").
The award of the MISA Entrepreneur Licence represents a strategic milestone for the Group and forms a core part of Active Energy's wider strategy to expand its footprint across the Middle East. The licence provides the Company with a formal, fully compliant platform to operate and scale within the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia ("
KSA
"), one of the world's fastest growing and most strategically important energy and technology markets.
Strategic Rationale
KSA is undergoing rapid economic transformation under Vision 2030, with strong demand across energy transition, digital infrastructure, advanced technologies and innovation-led businesses. Securing the Entrepreneur Licence positions Active Energy at an early stage within this growth cycle and enables the Company to pursue opportunities directly within the Kingdom.
The Entrepreneur Licence offers a more accessible and cost-efficient entry framework than traditional foreign investment licences, while still providing a full legal foundation to build and grow operations in Saudi Arabia. Importantly, the licence allows for 100% foreign ownership in eligible sectors and provides access to a broad range of entrepreneurial support mechanisms.
Key Strategic Advantages
·
Access to ultra-low-cost power
Saudi Arabia's expanding and highly competitive energy infrastructure provides Active Energy with the opportunity to secure ultra-low-cost power, a critical enabler for energy-intensive operations including digital infrastructure, AI-focused computing and advanced clean energy applications. This access underpins improved project economics, scalability and long-term operational resilience.
·
Access to capital, strategic partners and international counterparties
The Entrepreneur Licence enhances the Company's ability to engage with regional capital markets, including sovereign-linked capital, institutional investors and Sharia-compliant debt and structured financing solutions. In parallel, the licence positions the Company to develop strategic partnerships with the KSA and international companies seeking a compliant local operating platform, supporting joint ventures, co-development opportunities and the attraction of inbound foreign investment into the KSA.
·
Direct market entry into a fast-growing economy
The licence enables Active Energy to legally establish and operate in Saudi Arabia, providing direct access to a rapidly expanding economy with increasing demand for clean energy, digital infrastructure, and innovation-driven solutions.
·
Lower-cost setup and early-stage incentives
Initial licensing costs are materially lower than traditional foreign investment licences, reducing early-stage financial barriers and improving capital efficiency during market entry.
·
Platform for future growth and permitting
The licence provides a strong foundation for future expansion, including streamlined access to investor visas, work visas, and entrepreneur-related residency categories as operations scale.
·
Gateway for international partnerships
The licence enables Active Energy to leverage Saudi Arabia's expanding international trade and investment ecosystem, supporting the attraction of foreign counterparties and strategic partners seeking a compliant local platform.
Paul Elliott, Chief Executive Officer of Active Energy Group plc, commented:
"The successful award of the MISA Entrepreneur Licence is a major step forward for Active Energy and a clear validation of our Middle East strategy. Saudi Arabia is central to our long-term growth plans, and this licence provides the regulatory platform we need to execute, scale and partner effectively within the Kingdom.
Access to ultra-low-cost power, significant regional capital - including Sharia-compliant funding - and a rapidly developing digital and energy infrastructure creates a compelling environment for our business model. We believe this licence materially enhances our ability to deliver sustainable growth and long-term value for shareholders."
Enquiries:

(CEO)

(Non-Executive Chairman)

latest.title: OTC Markets ID, Ticker and US IR Appointment
latest.content:
15 Jan 2026 14:27
RNS Number : 1145P
Active Energy Group PLC
15 January 2026
15 January 2026
Active Energy Group plc
("Active Energy", the "Company" or the "Group")
OTC Markets ID, Ticker Update and US IR Appointment
Active Energy Group plc (AIM: AEG | OTC: AEUSF) announces that its shares have moved from trading on the OTCQB Venture Market to the OTC Integrated Disclosure Market (OTCID), further enhancing the Company's access to US and international investors.
The Company's ordinary shares are now eligible for trading on OTC Markets Group's extensive global platform, which provides broad investor reach across North America, Europe and Asia, with offices from New York through to Asia. This milestone supports Active Energy's strategy to expand its international shareholder base and improve global market visibility.
In connection with this, the Company confirms that its OTC ticker symbol has been updated to "AEUSF", reflecting Active Energy's status as a US-quoted foreign issuer.
Further information is available at:
https://www.otcmarkets.com/stock/AEUSF/overview
The Company also announces that it has entered into an agreement with Digitonic Limited ("Digitonic") to provide investor content and marketing services. Digitonic is an investor content marketing business based in Glasgow, Scotland, with a strong focus on the North American market.
Under the terms of the agreement, Digitonic will provide content creation, distribution and advertising services for an agreed four-month term, starting February 2026.
Paul Elliott, Chief Executive Officer of Active Energy Group plc, commented
:
"Becoming fully compliant on the OTC Markets ID platform and trading under the AEUSF ticker is a strategically important step for Active Energy. It allows us to significantly broaden our exposure to US and international investors and enables trading outside the traditional London market hours.
We are also pleased to be working with Digitonic, a highly regarded investor content and marketing specialist, as we continue to build awareness of Active Energy's strategy and growth opportunities in the North American market."
The Board believes that OTC Markets ID, combined with a targeted US investor engagement strategy, positions the Company strongly to support its next phase of growth.
Enquiries:
Active Energy Group Plc
Paul Elliott
(CEO)
Pankaj Rajani
(Non-Executive Chairman)
